Q4a_part1_set_down_variation.name: name
Q4a_part1_set_down_variation.question: Could you reason what this means for the set-down in the shoaling zone?

options.a: The highest mean water level occurs under the highest waves.
options.b: The lowest mean water level occurs under the highest waves.
options.c: The set-down is zero under the highest waves.

feedback.correct: Your answer is correct. The set-down was seen to depend on the wave height, so we can expect the largest set-down (lowest mean water level) under the largest waves.
feedback.incorrect: Your answer is incorrect. See Section 5.5.4 and especially Eq. 5.64 in the book. What may this imply for the occurence of the largest set-down in the group? When do we have the lowest mean water level?

Q4a_part1_radiation_stress_variation.name: name
Q4a_part1_radiation_stress_variation.question: What did you learn about the variation of the radiation stress Sₓₓ?

options.a: Sₓₓ is highest under the highest waves in the group.
options.b: Sₓₓ is highest under the lowest waves in the group.
options.c: Sₓₓ is zero at the nodes of the envelope.
options.d: Sₓₓ is equal to its wave-group averaged value at the nodes of the envelope.

feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. Consider how Sₓₓ varies with A(x,t).

Q4a_part2_orbital_velocities.name: name
Q4a_part2_orbital_velocities.question: How do the orbital velocties of the bound long wave vary within the wave group?

options.a: The maximum onshore velocities coincide with the maximum of the envelope.
options.b: The maximum offshore velocities coincide with the maximum of the envelope.
options.c: The maximum onshore velocities coincide with the minimum of the envelope.
options.d: The maximum offshore velocities coincide with the minimum of the envelope.

feedback.correct: Correct! The trough of the bound long wave and, hence, the maximum offshore orbital velocties coincide with the maximum of the envelope or the highest waves in the group.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. Are the orbital velocties under a wave crest in or against wave propagation direction. And under a wave trough?
